definitions.definition: Having the faculty of sensation ; pertaining to the senses .

examples: Max is very sensitive ; he cried today because of the bad news.

definitions.definition: Capable of offending , upsetting , or hurting .
examples: Religion is often a sensitive topic of discussion and should be avoided when dealing with foreign business associates.

definitions.definition: Meant to be concealed or kept secret .
Being aware of the feelings of others and taking care not to offend them.
Important , intricate , and requiring great delicacy .
examples: The president's untimely statement disrupted some very sensitive negotiations.

definitions.definition: Accurate ; able to register small changes in some property .
Having paranormal abilities that can be controlled through mesmerism .

main_definition: Having the faculty of sensation ; pertaining to the senses .
secondary_definitions: ( of a person ) Easily offended , upset , or hurt .
( of an issue, topic, etc. ) Capable of offending , upsetting , or hurting .
Meant to be concealed or kept secret .
Being aware of the feelings of others and taking care not to offend them.
Important , intricate , and requiring great delicacy .
( of an instrument ) Accurate ; able to register small changes in some property .
( archaic ) Having paranormal abilities that can be controlled through mesmerism .
